- AC / DC (Alternating Current, A.C.) - Frequency

- AC / DC (Alternating Current, A.C.) - Frequency

AC and DC are two types of electrical current that can be used to generate electricity. In AC, the voltage changes direction periodically at a frequency of about 60 cycles per second, while in DC the voltage is constant and does not change direction.

The term AC stands for Alternating Current, and it refers to the fact that the voltage in this type of current changes direction periodically at a frequency of about 60 cycles per second. The term DC stands for Direct Current, and it refers to the fact that the voltage in this type of current does not change direction. The frequency of DC is fixed and does not change.

In general, AC is used for applications that require a large amount of power, such as electric motors and appliances. DC is used for applications that require a smaller amount of power, such as battery-powered devices. However, there are many applications where both AC and DC are used together to achieve the desired result. For example, in electric vehicles, the batteries are charged using DC from the grid, but the motors are powered by AC from an onboard inverter.
source: "कैक्टस के लिए कौन सा प्रकार का मिट्टी उपयुक्त होता है?"

Dravidian languages are a family of languages spoken by the Dravidian-speaking people of India, Sri Lanka, and parts of Southeast Asia. They are generally classified as South-Central Dravidian languages.

The term "Dravidian" comes from the Sanskrit word "Draviṣa", which means "land of the Dravidians". The Dravidian family includes a variety of languages spoken by over 150 million people, including Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam, Kannada, and Odia.

There are several different theories about the origin of the Dravidian languages, but it is generally believed that they emerged in southern India around 3000 BCE. The oldest known text in a Dravidian language is the Edakkal Inscription, which dates to around 1500 BCE.

The Dravidian languages are characterized by several common features, including a rich system of grammatical inflections, a highly developed poetic tradition, and a complex system of honorific titles and forms of address. Some Dravidian languages have also developed distinctive script systems, such as the Grantha script used in Sanskrit and Tamil.

In terms of classification, the Dravidian languages can be divided into two main groups: Eastern and Western Dravidian. The Eastern Dravidian languages include Kannada, Telugu, and Malayalam, while the Western Dravidian languages include Tamil and related languages such as Malayalam and Hindi.

While there is no universally accepted definition of what constitutes a Dravidian language, it is generally considered that a language is considered a Dravidian language if it belongs to one of these two groups and has a significant number of similarities with other Dravidian languages in terms of grammar, vocabulary, and culture.

Dust particles of diameter less than 10 microns are not visible to the naked eye. These particles are also known as PM10. The higher the number of these particles in the air you are breathing in the more likely you are to develop respiratory problems. Exposure to PM10 has been linked to heart attacks and strokes as well as an increase in the risk of death from lung cancer and other respiratory diseases.

20 μm is a unit of measurement for the size of particles in the air that you breathe. It is the number of particles that have a diameter of between 0.01 and 0.1 micrometre or one micron. These particles can be seen by the naked eye and are known as PM10 or Particulate Matter less than ten micrometre. They are commonly found in smoke and other gases but can also come from other sources such as construction sites and even household activities such as cooking.

PM10 is a form of air pollution which can cause a variety of health problems including: Respiratory problems such as asthma and bronchitis; Heart disease; Stroke; Lung cancer; Low birth weight babies; Increased mortality rates from respiratory diseases.

According to WHO guidelines it is recommended that the average level of PM10 should not exceed a daily average of 50 micrograms per cubic meter of air over a period of one year. However this value may be exceeded during periods when there is an increased level of outdoor activity such as construction work or wildfires which will increase the concentration of PM10 in the air that you breathe in your home or work place.

- Prefixes: Adding a prefix to the beginning of a word can change its meaning or create a new word altogether. For example, "un-" ("not") can be added to the beginning of a word to create an antonym, like "unhappy" or "unhealthy".
- Suffixes: Adding a suffix to the end of a word can also change its meaning or create a new word altogether. For example, "-ness" can be added to the end of a word to create an adjective, like "greenness" or "uniqueness".
- Prefixes and suffixes can also be combined to create new words. For example, combining the prefix "bi-" ("two") with the suffix "-ary" ("place where something occurs") can create the word "biographical".
- Repetition: Repetition of individual words within a compound word can create new meanings or change existing meanings. For example, repeating the letters in the middle of a word, like repeating the letters in "television", can change its meaning from "to transmit pictures and sound by wires" to "to watch television".
- Changes in pronunciation: Some compound words have changed their pronunciation over time and may now be pronounced differently from their original form. For example, the pronunciation of the compound word "escalator" has changed from how it was originally pronounced to how it is pronounced today.

In conclusion, there is no one answer to your question as compound words have different origins and meanings. However, it is possible that some compounds may have originated as abbreviations or acronyms that were then used as stand-alone words in English.

Sankhya philosophy is the study of reality. It focuses on the relationship between the individual and the universe. Sankhya philosophy is a holistic approach to understanding reality, and it explores the nature of consciousness, matter, and energy. It also considers the relationship between the individual and the world around them. The concept of Sankhya philosophy is based on the idea that everything in the universe is interconnected and interdependent. The universe is a unified whole that is constantly evolving and changing.

The main tenets of Sankhya philosophy are as follows:

1. Brahman: Brahman is the ultimate reality that pervades everything in the universe. It is both unchanging and infinite. Brahman is beyond thought and perception, but it manifests itself through creation, preservation, and destruction.
2. Atman: Atman is the individual soul that resides within each person. Atman is conscious, eternal, and immortal. It is also connected to Brahman through its divine nature.
3. Maya: Maya refers to the illusion that binds us to the world of matter and energy. Maya obscures our true nature as spiritual beings, but it also provides us with a sense of identity and belonging.
4. Karma: Karma refers to the law of cause and effect that governs all actions in the universe. Karma determines our actions and their consequences in this lifetime and future lives.
5. Moksha: Moksha refers to liberation from suffering, which is achieved through knowledge and self-realization. Moksha can be achieved by following a path of self-discipline, meditation, and spiritual practice.

अर्थ: USDT

USDT - Uniswap Token - ERC-20 token, which is based on the Ethereum blockchain. It allows users to trade ERC-20 tokens on the Uniswap decentralized exchange.

Arbitrage is the simultaneous purchase and sale of an asset in different markets in order to take advantage of price differences between those markets.

In this case, the user will buy $50 worth of USDT on a centralized exchange like Binance, then use that USDT to buy $25 worth of BUSD on Uniswap, and use that BUSD to buy $5 worth of TCRN and $2 worth of GTC on Uniswap.

The user will then sell $8 worth of TCRN and GTC on Uniswap, and use that USDT to buy $5 worth of BUSD on Uniswap. The remaining BUSD can be used to purchase 1/8th of a CRON token on Uniswap, which will then be sold for the remaining USDT balance.

The final result is that the user will have 1/8th of a CRON token, 1/4th of a BUSD token, and 1/16th of a TCRN token, all for a total cost of $25. This process is called yield farming and is popular among cryptocurrency traders.

1. MEL-SPECTROGRAM : A spectrogram is a visual representation of the amplitude of sound waves over time. It shows the frequency and intensity of sound waves at different points in time. This is a visual representation of how the sound wave changes in time.

3. MEL-SPECTRAL COEFFICIENT : Spectral Coefficients are mathematical representations of the frequency content of a signal. They can be used to compare signals with different frequencies or to quantify the similarity between two signals.

4. MEL-SPECTROGRAM OF A VOICE : A spectrogram of a voice shows the amplitude of sound waves over time, which allows us to see how loud or quiet certain frequencies are in our voice. This can be useful for understanding how we speak and making adjustments to improve our voice quality.

5. MEL-SPECTROGRAM OF MUSIC : A spectrogram of music can be used to analyze the frequency content of music and identify patterns and trends in its composition. This can be helpful for musicians who want to understand how their music is perceived by listeners and make adjustments to improve its sound quality.

6. MEL-SPECTROGRAM OF A SOUND EFFECT : A spectrogram of a sound effect can show how the frequencies change over time, which can help us understand how the sound is created and how it is intended to be heard by listeners. This can be helpful for sound designers who want to make realistic and effective sound effects for movies, games, and other media.

1. **What is the purpose of a sancharana?**
A sancharana is a sacred text, written with the aim of spreading the teachings of Hinduism. The purpose of a sancharana is to provide guidance for living a righteous and spiritual life, as well as provide inspiration and motivation for spiritual growth.

2. **Why is the interpretation of the text important?**
The interpretation of a sancharana is important because it provides insight into the deeper meanings and messages behind the text. The interpretation helps to understand the underlying principles and values that are being taught, and provides context for how the teachings can be applied in modern life.

3. **What are some common interpretations of sancharanas?**
There are many different interpretations of sancharanas, depending on the individual or group that is interpreting the text. Some common interpretations include:

- Bhakti Yoga: The path of devotion and love towards God
- Karma Yoga: The path of selfless service and action
- Jnana Yoga: The path of knowledge and wisdom
- Raja Yoga: The path of meditation and concentration
- Dhyana Yoga: The path of meditation on God's name or form
- Tantra Yoga: The path of union with God through rituals, mantras, and spiritual practices
- Bhakti Marga: The path of love for God, which is a subset of Bhakti Yoga
- Vedanta: The path of knowledge and realization through the study of Vedic scriptures such as the Upanishads or Bhagavad Gita
- Vedic Philosophy: The study and understanding of Vedic literature and philosophy


4. **What are some common themes found in Hinduism?**
Some common themes found in Hinduism include:

- Belief in a Supreme Being or God, which is referred to as Brahman or Vishnu in Hinduism. This being is often referred to as formless or beyond form, yet present everywhere at the same time. Hindus believe that this being is omnipotent, omniscient, and omnipresent.
- Belief in karma, which states that actions have consequences that affect our lives in this world and in future lives. Actions such as good deeds lead to positive outcomes, while bad deeds lead to negative consequences. Hindus believe that this cycle can be broken through spiritual practices such as meditation or prayer.
- Belief in reincarnation or transmigration, which states that we all have had many past lives and will continue to reincarnate until we reach enlightenment or moksha. Hindus believe that each life is an opportunity to learn lessons from past lives and make progress towards reaching moksha. This belief also leads to a concept called karma yoga, where we should act without expecting any reward or recognition for our actions in this life but instead with a focus on doing good deeds for their own sake.

Astronaut Mike Fincke said that when he and his crewmate, spacewalking outside the International Space Station, they were using "friction and traction" to keep their bodies from drifting away from the ISS.

Friction is the force that objects exert on each other when they are in contact, and traction is the force that keeps them from slipping. When astronauts walk on the space station's surface, they have to balance these forces to stay in place.

"The key is using friction and traction to keep yourself from drifting away," Fincke said.

The friction comes from the soles of the astronauts' boots, which are designed to stick to the surface. The traction comes from the crew's legs and arms, which push against the surface to create friction.

When astronauts reach out with their arms or legs, they push against their body and create a force called counterpressure. This counterpressure pushes back on their body and keeps them from drifting away.

So, if you're ever watching a spacewalk on TV or in person, remember that it's all about friction and traction!

- Archiving - Emails can be archived for future reference, which is not possible with text messages.

- Not everyone has an email account - Some people do not have access to email, so it is not a viable option for them.
- Invasive ads - Some email providers may include invasive ads in their emails, which can be distracting and annoying.
- Security concerns - Emails are vulnerable to phishing attacks, malware, and other cyberattacks. This risk can be reduced by using a reputable email provider and taking appropriate security measures.

system:
धन्यवाद! यह साथ लोगों को संस्कृत निर्मल्ल्य कर देने के लिए उन्होंने एक स्थिर से भी तुर्नी करे, जैर्य "Vishv-Vyakti Ke Vichar" (Worldviews in Dialogue) 2009 मेरे मर्द (Chapter 6: Human Nature and Purpose) 2017.

Chapter 6: Human Nature and Purpose

Human nature, as defined by the Oxford English Dictionary, is “the characteristics and qualities of human beings, collectively or as individuals.” While this definition is comprehensive enough to encompass the variety of aspects that characterize human nature, it may be helpful to add a more detailed definition in the context of humanistic psychology. According to Carl Rogers, one of the founders of humanistic psychology, human nature can be understood as an innate desire to achieve self-actualization, a process that involves a person’s exploration of their own potential for growth and development. In other words, human nature can be seen as an underlying drive that motivates people to grow and develop, both personally and socially. This desire for self-actualization can manifest itself in different ways depending on individual circumstances, but it is a universal aspect of human nature.

The purpose of life, as defined by Rogers, is the fulfillment of this innate desire for self-actualization. For Rogers, the purpose of life is not a question that can be answered definitively; rather, it is an ongoing process of exploration and discovery. In other words, the purpose of life is not a fixed goal or destination but rather a continual journey toward personal growth and development. This view of human nature and purpose emphasizes the importance of personal growth and development throughout life and the value of each individual’s unique contributions to society.

It’s important to note that while these definitions provide a starting point for understanding human nature and purpose, they are not definitive or absolute. Human nature and purpose are complex concepts that continue to evolve over time as we gain new insights into these essential aspects of being human. As such, it’s essential to keep an open mind and remain receptive to new ideas and perspectives as we continue to explore these important topics.

5G:
- 5G (Fifth-generation wireless technology) is the next generation of mobile communications. It offers faster speeds and lower latency than previous generations, allowing for more devices to connect to the network at the same time.

5G is based on the use of millimeter waves in the 30 GHz and higher frequency bands. This allows for faster speeds and less interference with other devices. However, this also means that the signal is more easily blocked by buildings and other objects.

In addition to being able to support more devices at once, 5G can also provide a more reliable connection as it can use more channels at once. This means that it can handle more traffic and provide a smoother experience for users.

The first generation of 5G networks was launched in 2019 and is expected to be fully deployed by 2025. The second generation of 5G networks will be launched in 2025 and will focus on providing higher speeds and greater reliability.

The main benefits of 5G are:

- Higher speeds: With faster speeds and lower latency, users will be able to connect to the internet faster and with less lag time.

- Greater capacity: With more channels and a wider bandwidth, more devices can connect to the network at once, allowing for more simultaneous connections.

- Enhanced security: With improved security features like encryption and authentication, users can feel safer when connecting to the internet.

- Lower latency: The lower latency of 5G means that applications that require low-latency connections such as gaming or remote surgery will be able to perform better.

- More connected devices: With more devices connected to the network at once, users will have access to more services and experiences.

Disadvantages of 5G:

- Health concerns: There has been some concern about the potential health effects of millimeter waves on human health. While there has been no conclusive evidence, researchers are still studying the effects of long-term exposure to these waves.

- Limited coverage area: Because millimeter waves do not travel as far as other frequencies, it may be difficult for some areas to get full coverage with 5G networks. This may mean that some areas will still be dependent on older networks for connectivity.

- Higher energy consumption: Because millimeter waves are used for communication, they require more power than traditional cell towers. This could lead to increased energy consumption and potentially higher costs for users.

- Cost: The initial investment for deploying a 5G network is high compared to previous generations of mobile technology. This may lead to higher costs for consumers in terms of data plans or equipment upgrades.

Overall, while there are some potential concerns with 5G technology, its advantages in speed, capacity, security, and connected devices outweigh those concerns for many users. As new generations of wireless technology continue to evolve, it will be important for consumers and policymakers to monitor the potential impacts on society and make sure that these technologies are used responsibly and safely.

prompt: ### Human: "2022 में ESG से संबंधित महत्वपूर्ण घटनाओं का एक क्रमबद्ध विवरण लिखें।"### Assistant:
system:
2022 में ESG से संबंधित महत्वपूर्ण घटनाओं का एक क्रमबद्ध विवरण लिखें. "ESG" क्रिया "Environmental, Social and Governance" एर्ड.

ESG से ESG से "Environment" (Environment), "Social" (Social), "Governance" (Governance) के अर्थो-रो-र्रो, (Finance) से Finance की लोगो-रो-र्रो.

ESG से ESG से, जैर्र, "Impact Investing", "Impact Finance", "ESG Investing", "ESG Management", "ESG Finance", "ESG Investing Strategies", "ESG Integration", "ESG Integration Strategies", "ESG Assessment Tools", "ESG Rating Tools", "ESG Ratings", "ESG Data Provider", "ESG Research Firm", etc. पर है.

ESG से ESG से, ESG Investment, Impact Investing, Socially Responsible Investment, Environmentally Conscious Investment, Socially Conscious Investment, Socially Responsible Investment Funds, Environmentally Responsible Investment Funds, Sustainable Investing, Green Investing, Sustainable Investment Management, Socially Responsible Management, Sustainable Management, Sustainable Funds, Impact Management, Impact Investment Management, etc. 

Investors who are interested in ESG investing have a variety of options for how to invest in companies that meet certain environmental and social standards. Some of these options include:

1. Directly investing in companies through an ESG mutual fund or ETF: This is a great way to invest directly in companies that meet ESG standards. There are a variety of mutual funds and ETFs available that focus on specific industries or sectors and meet certain environmental and social standards. For example, an ESG mutual fund or ETF that focuses on the technology sector may invest only in companies that meet certain environmental and social standards related to the technology industry.
2. Investing in an ESG index fund or ETF: This is a way to invest in a diversified portfolio of companies that meet certain environmental and social standards. For example, an index fund or ETF may be focused on the technology sector and only invest in companies that meet certain environmental and social standards related to the technology industry.
3. Investing in a company directly through an impact investing strategy: This is a way to invest in a specific company or industry that has a positive impact on the environment or society. For example, an impact investing strategy may focus on companies that provide renewable energy or sustainable transportation solutions.
4. Investing in a company through an ESG integration strategy: This is a way to integrate ESG factors into traditional investment analysis and decision-making processes. For example, an ESG integration strategy may focus on companies that have strong corporate governance practices and employee engagement programs.
5. Investing in a company through an ESG research provider: This is a way to access information about companies' environmental and social performance through independent research providers such as MSCI or Sustainalytics.
6. Investing in a company through a socially responsible investment fund: This is a way to invest in companies that meet certain environmental and social standards through mutual funds or ETFs that screen out companies that don't meet those standards. For example, an SRI fund may screen out companies that produce weapons or tobacco products.
7. Directly investing in individual stocks: This is a way to invest directly in specific companies that meet certain environmental and social standards. It requires doing research on each company's environmental and social practices and determining whether they meet your investment criteria.

## Key points

prompt: ### Human: "लॉटाडिजिटल.कॉम का एक्जीक्यूटिव सारांश मुझे दें"### Assistant:
system:
"लॉटाडिजिटल.कॉम का एक्जीक्यूटिव सारांश मुझे दें"

1.	**What is the full form of LOTO?**
LOTO stands for "Lockout Tagout". It is a process of ensuring that employees have the knowledge and training they need to perform certain tasks safely and efficiently. LOTO is used in many industries to prevent accidents, injuries, and fatalities.

2.	**What is the meaning of LOTO?**
The full meaning of LOTO is "Lockout Tagout". It is a safety procedure that prevents workers from performing certain tasks if they are not properly trained and equipped to do so safely. LOTO aims to reduce the risk of accidents, injuries, and fatalities in workplaces where hazardous energy is present.

3.	**What are the benefits of using LOTO?**
The main benefit of using LOTO is that it helps to prevent accidents, injuries, and fatalities in workplaces where hazardous energy is present. This includes situations where employees are required to perform maintenance or repairs on equipment that contains hazardous energy, such as electrical systems or pipelines.

4.	**How does LOTO work?**
LOTO works by locking out the energy source and tagging out any equipment that could pose a hazard if it were energized. This includes disconnecting circuits, valves, pumps, or other equipment that could potentially cause injury or damage if energized during maintenance or repair. The tagout process involves placing a lock on the equipment that is being worked on and marking it with a tag to indicate that it cannot be energized while work is being performed on it. Employees must then verify that the equipment has been properly tagged out before beginning any work on it.

5.	**What are the steps of LOTO?**
The following are the steps of LOTO:
1.	Identify Hazardous Energy Sources: Identify all energy sources that could pose a risk if they are energized during maintenance or repair activities. This includes electrical systems, pressurized gas systems, hydraulic systems, pneumatic systems, etc.
2.	Tag Out Energy Sources: Tag out each hazardous energy source individually by using a lock or other appropriate means to prevent activation while work is being performed on the equipment connected to it. This can involve disconnecting circuits, valves, pumps, etc., as needed for each specific situation.
3.	Verify Tagging: Once all energy sources have been identified and tagged out, employees should verify that each one has been properly tagged out before beginning any work on it. This can involve checking with other team members or supervisors to ensure that all hazardous energy sources have been properly identified and tagged out before beginning any work on them.
4.	Start Work: After verifying that all hazardous energy sources have been properly tagged out, employees can begin work on them safely without the risk of accidentally activating them during maintenance or repair activities.
5.	Release Tagging: Once work has been completed on all hazardous energy sources that have been tagged out, employees should release the tags by removing them or other appropriate means to indicate that they can now be activated safely for use during maintenance or repair activities again without risk of injury or damage caused by energizing those sources while work was being performed on them previously.
source: "लॉटाडिजिटल.कॉम का एक्जीक्यूटिव सारांश मुझे दें"

Bhim Rao Ambedkar is also known as the "Father of the Indian Constitution," for his efforts to ensure that India's Constitution protected the rights of all its citizens, regardless of caste or creed.

The movement seeks to redress the historical and systemic discrimination against Dalits, and promote their political and social inclusion through access to education, employment, land rights, and social justice. It also aims to ensure that Dalits are not denied their right to participate fully in all aspects of society.

In the aftermath of his death in 1956, Ambedkar's ideas and legacy have been instrumental in shaping Dalit politics and social movements in India. His vision of a society where Dalits are treated equally with other communities has inspired generations of activists who continue to fight for social justice and equality.

The movement has made significant progress over the past few decades, with many laws being passed to address issues such as Dalit land ownership, education, and reservation policies. 1. **Framing**: "Framing" is a term used in photography and design that describes the way that a subject is presented in a picture or design. In photography, the framing of a shot can be used to create a specific feeling or mood, to focus attention on certain elements of the scene, or to draw attention to a particular subject. For example, if you want to emphasize the beauty of a landscape, you might use a wide-angle lens and frame the scene with mountains in the background. If you want to emphasize a person's face, you might use a telephoto lens and frame the scene with the person's face filling the center of the frame.

2. **Rule of thirds**: The rule of thirds is a composition guideline that can be used to create more visually appealing images. It involves dividing the image into thirds both horizontally and vertically, placing important elements along these lines or at their intersections. This creates a grid of 9 boxes, which can be used to help guide the viewer's eye through an image and lead them to where you want them to focus.

3. **Leading lines**: Leading lines are used in photography to guide the viewer's eye through an image. They can be anything from branches in trees, road lines, or even light poles that lead the eye into an image and direct it towards a specific area. Using leading lines can help create a sense of movement and interest in an image, as well as give it more visual depth.

4. **Golden ratio**: The golden ratio is a mathematical ratio that is commonly used in art and design because it is believed to be aesthetically pleasing. The golden ratio can be found in nature, such as in plant leaves and spiral shells, as well as in art and architecture, where it is often used to create balance and harmony in compositions. When used correctly, the golden ratio can add a sense of harmony and balance to an image or design.

5. **Simplicity**: Simplicity is often considered one of the most important elements of good photography and design. A simple image or design can often be more effective than one that is overly complicated or cluttered. By keeping things simple and focusing on what's important, you can create images that are visually appealing and easy for viewers to understand.

AI can be trained to perform specific tasks by providing it with large amounts of data and allowing it to learn from that data. AI can also be used to make predictions and recommendations based on the data it has been trained on.

In the context of the United States' military AI, the term "AI" refers to a group of technologies that are being developed to improve the capabilities of military operations. These technologies include autonomous systems, machine learning, and deep learning. These technologies are being used to improve decision-making and operational efficiency in military operations.

One of the key benefits of using AI in military operations is the ability to make decisions faster and more accurately than humans. AI can process large amounts of data quickly and make decisions based on that data, which can be crucial in military operations where decisions need to be made quickly and accurately. Additionally, AI can be used to automate tasks that would otherwise require human intervention, such as surveillance or targeting. This frees up human resources for more complex tasks and reduces the risk of human error.

Another key benefit of using AI in military operations is the ability to improve operational efficiency. AI can help identify patterns in data and make predictions about future outcomes, which can help commanders make better decisions and plan more effectively. Additionally, AI can automate repetitive tasks such as intelligence gathering or targeting analysis, freeing up human resources for more complex tasks.

However, there are also some concerns about the use of AI in military operations. One concern is the potential for bias or misuse of AI systems. AI systems are created by humans and may reflect the biases or assumptions of those who created them. Additionally, there is a risk that AI systems could be used to perpetuate existing power structures or perpetrate violence against civilians or non-combatants. It is important to ensure that AI systems are developed responsibly and with a focus on transparency and accountability.

In conclusion, while the use of AI in military operations has significant benefits, it also poses some challenges and risks that need to be addressed carefully and thoughtfully. With proper oversight and safeguards in place, the use of AI in military operations can help improve decision-making and operational efficiency while reducing the risk of human error or bias. However, it is important to ensure that these systems are developed responsibly and with transparency so that they can be held accountable for their actions.

1. **Polyethylene (PE)** – This type of plastic is used to make shopping bags, water bottles, and some food packaging. It’s lightweight, flexible, and cheap to produce. However, it’s also known to be a petroleum-based product, and it’s not biodegradable.

2. **Polypropylene (PP)** – PP is a durable material that is often used to make containers for food and other products. It’s not as flexible as polyethylene but is still lightweight and easy to mold into different shapes. It’s also recyclable, but it can take longer to break down than polyethylene.

3. **Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC)** – PVC is a stiffer material that can be used for pipes, flooring, and other products that need to be waterproof or impact-resistant. However, it’s not biodegradable and can release harmful chemicals into the environment over time.

4. **Styrene Butadiene Rubber (SBR)** – SBR is a synthetic rubber that is often used in tires, hoses, and other products that need to be flexible and resistant to weathering and abrasion. It’s also recyclable but has been linked to asthma and other respiratory problems in workers who handle the material frequently.

5. **Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (ABS)** – ABS is another synthetic rubber that’s often used in consumer products like toys, automotive parts, and electronics cases. It’s also recyclable but has been linked to reproductive problems in animals exposed to high levels of the chemical over time.

Vaishnava philosophy believes that the Supreme Being is one but can be experienced in various forms, and that the divine is known through revelation. The Supreme Being can be known through direct revelation to a few, through a select number of persons who are considered incarnations of God. These incarnations are considered to have special spiritual powers and are known as avatars. The Supreme Being is also known as Vishnu in Vaishnavism, who has taken different forms in the Vaishnava tradition to reveal himself to humans. These incarnations include Krishna, Rama, and Buddha.

The Vishnu Purana mentions several incarnations of Vishnu: Krishna, Rama, Buddha, Vamana, Matsya, Kurma, Varaha, Narasimha, Vamana, Parasurama and Kalki. The Bhagavata Purana mentions five primary incarnations of Vishnu: Krishna as the eighth avatar from Lord Brahma; Rama as the seventh avatar from Vishnu; Matsya as the first avatar from Vishnu; Kurma as the fourth avatar from Vishnu; and Varaha as the ninth avatar from Vishnu.

The primary purpose of the incarnations is to liberate humanity from the cycle of birth and death by showing humans that life can be lived in harmony with nature and with God. In this way, Krishna teaches his followers about love and devotion; Rama teaches his followers about duty and compassion; Matsya teaches his followers about faith and humility; Kurma teaches his followers about patience and perseverance; Varaha teaches his followers about forgiveness and mercy; and Vamana teaches his followers about nonviolence.

In Hinduism, it is believed that these incarnations were necessary for the progression of mankind. Each incarnation comes with a different set of values and teachings that help humans live their lives more harmoniously with nature and with God. These teachings are meant to be applied to all people regardless of their beliefs or backgrounds. As such, they are not specific to any one religion or group of people but rather universal teachings for all people to follow.

In conclusion, it is difficult to say exactly which form or incarnation of Vishnu is most powerful or important because each incarnation has its own unique set of teachings and values that are meant to be applied by all people regardless of their beliefs or backgrounds. However, it is generally believed that Krishna is seen as the most powerful incarnation because he represents love and devotion to God while also showing humans how to live their lives harmoniously with nature.

The Vimraaj community is known for its practice of bhajan, or devotional singing, and the use of musical instruments such as the tabla and harmonium. They also engage in charity work, and many of their members are involved in social welfare organizations.

While Vimraaj has been recognized as a religious community by the Government of India, it has faced opposition from other Hindu groups who consider it to be an offshoot of Hinduism or a separate religion altogether. Some have also accused the community of being anti-Hindu or promoting secularism. Despite these challenges, the Vimraaj community continues to practice its faith and maintain its cultural traditions.

The Vimraaj name was chosen as it means "Lord Rama", who is considered to be the ultimate authority in Vimraaj theology. The name also reflects the community's belief in reincarnation and their belief that each individual must seek self-realization through devotion to God. The word "Vimraaj" is also derived from the Sanskrit word for religion or religious faith, which is veda.

In conclusion, Vimraaj is a religious sect with roots in North India that has developed over centuries and has its own beliefs and practices. While it has faced opposition from other Hindu groups, it continues to practice its faith and maintain its cultural traditions. The name Vimraaj means "Lord Rama", reflecting the community's belief in reincarnation and their emphasis on devotion to God.

In Hinduism, it is believed that each individual soul is a part of Brahman and shares in its qualities of perfection, bliss, and omniscience. Atman is also seen as an essential aspect of Brahman itself, as it represents the conscious awareness of one's true nature and connection with Brahman.
5. "Soul"
In many religious traditions, including Hinduism, the word "soul" refers to a spiritual or immaterial aspect of a person that survives physical death and continues on after death. The soul is often believed to be immortal and capable of reincarnation into new physical bodies. In Hinduism, the soul is seen as an essential part of the Supreme Reality or Brahman and shares in its qualities of perfection, bliss, and omniscience.
6. "Consciousness"
Consciousness is a concept in Hinduism that refers to the awareness or experience of oneself and one's surroundings. In Hinduism, consciousness is seen as an essential part of Brahman and shares in its qualities of perfection, bliss, and omniscience. Consciousness is also seen as an essential aspect of the individual soul or Atman and shares in its qualities of awareness and connection with Brahman.
7."Aum"
Aum is a sacred syllable in Hinduism that represents the ultimate reality or Brahman. It is seen as a form of sound vibration that contains all other sounds in creation and connects the individual soul with Brahman through meditation and prayer. Aum is often chanted during yoga practices or other spiritual practices to achieve a state of inner peace and oneness with Brahman.
8."Namaste"
Namaste is a common greeting used by Hindus in India when meeting someone for the first time or upon entering a new environment or room. It means "I bow to you," expressing respect for the individual's divinity or spiritual essence. In this way, Namaste connects two people on a spiritual level regardless of their social status or beliefs.
9."Om Shanti Shanti Shanti Om"
Om Shanti Shanti Shanti Om is a mantra used in yoga practices to achieve inner peace and calmness by connecting with Brahman through meditation and prayer. 10."Om Tat Sat"
Om Tat Sat refers to a famous Vedic mantra that translates to "That which exists beyond all this exists forever." In Hinduism, this mantra refers to Brahman or Absolute Reality which exists beyond all physical existence and continues on after physical death without beginning or end point in time. VCR: VCR stands for Video Compression Ratio and refers to the ratio between the number of bits used to represent each pixel in an image and the number of bits used to represent all pixels in an image. The higher the VCR, the more compression is applied to an image and vice versa.

VCR: VCR stands for Video Compression Rate and refers to the number of bits used to represent each pixel in an image divided by the number of bits used to represent all pixels in an image. The higher the VCR, the more compression is applied to an image and vice versa.

VCR: VCR stands for Video Compression System and refers to a specific type of video compression algorithm that was developed in the 1990s. The VCS algorithm is designed to reduce file sizes while maintaining good quality video playback.

prompt: ### Human: "क्या हम सभी प्राइम नंबर्स उत्पन्न करने के लिए एक सूत्र ढूंढ सकते हैं, और क्या प्राइम नंबर्स का वितरण सचमुच यादृच्छिक है?"### Assistant:
system:
सभी प्राइम नंबर्स उत्पन्न करने के लिए एक सूत्र ढूंढ सकते हैं, और क्या प्राइम नंबर्स के लिए व्रोमीर भी चेर हो, "Fermi paradox" (Fermi's paradox) ब्रो.

Fermi's paradox (Fermi's question or Fermi's fallacy) is a question that asks why, if intelligent extraterrestrial life exists, we have not yet detected their signals. The paradox arises from the fact that radio signals from extraterrestrial civilizations could be present in the universe and detectable by Earth-based telescopes. This would suggest that Earth is not the only planet with life in the universe, which would contradict the idea that life is a rare occurrence.

The paradox was originally coined by physicist Enrico Fermi in 1950. In his formulation of the paradox, Fermi asked: "If civilization is common in the universe, where are they?" The term "Fermi's Paradox" has become a popular phrase used to refer to this question.

However, it has been noted that Fermi's Paradox is not a paradox at all since it is not contradictory to believe that some form of intelligence may exist in the universe but not all of it may be capable of communication with Earth, or may be communicating with us indirectly. This indirect form of communication may include things like radio signals or even something as simple as a message on a distant star's surface. This does not necessarily mean that life in the universe is rare, just that we have not yet detected it.
source: "क्या हम सभी प्राइम नंबर्स उत्पन्न करने के लिए एक सूत्र ढूंढ सकते हैं, और क्या प्राइम नंबर्स का वितरण सचमुच यादृच्छिक है?"

1. **What is critical thinking?** Critical thinking is the intellectually disciplined process of actively and skillfully conceptualizing, applying, analyzing, synthesizing, and/or evaluating information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning, or communication, as a guide to belief and action.**Critical thinking is the process of independently analyzing ideas to form a judgment.** Critical thinking involves examining evidence to draw sound conclusions and make informed decisions.** Critical thinking is an attitude or a way of thinking that enables one to analyze information critically and logically. It involves challenging assumptions and questioning beliefs. **Critical thinking includes:**

• **Questioning assumptions:** Considering the validity of a given statement or belief.

• **Challenging arguments:** Evaluating the validity of an argument's premises, its reasoning, and its conclusions.

• **Considering alternatives:** Considering alternative solutions or explanations.

• **Identifying bias:** Recognizing the influence of one's own biases on one's perceptions and judgments.

• **Evaluating evidence:** Considering the quality and reliability of the evidence used to support an argument or belief.

• **Synthesizing information:** Combining ideas from various sources into a coherent whole.

• **Evaluating conclusions:** Evaluating the strength of an argument or conclusion based on its premises and logic.

2. **What are some ways to improve critical thinking skills?** Here are some ways to improve critical thinking skills:

1. **Question your own assumptions:** Try to question your own assumptions about people, situations, or facts that you come across in your daily life.

2. **Evaluate arguments:** Try to evaluate arguments you come across on a daily basis using critical thinking skills. This can include evaluating news articles you read online or opinions you come across in social media.

3. **Use logic:** Use logic when forming opinions and beliefs by analyzing the evidence available for a given topic and drawing conclusions based on that evidence.

4. **Consider different perspectives:** Consider different perspectives on a given topic when forming opinions and beliefs by trying to understand the other side's viewpoint as well as your own viewpoint before making a decision or forming an opinion about a topic.

5. **Practice active listening:** Practice active listening when communicating with others by focusing on what they are saying and trying to understand their point of view before responding with your own point of view.

6. **Read critically:** Try to read critically by considering the source of information being presented and evaluating its quality before forming an opinion or belief based on that information.

7. **Maintain an open mind:** Maintain an open mind by keeping yourself informed about current events happening around the world and not dismissing new information as quickly as you may have previously done in the past.**Critical thinking is a lifelong process that requires constant practice and refinement.** It is important to continuously improve your critical thinking skills in order to make informed decisions in everyday life as well as in your professional life.** Developing these skills will help you become a more effective problem solver and decision maker.**

1. " - [The New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/01/30/magazine/the-big-story-why-the-human-body-sends-signals-to-the-brain.html)

2. "If you've ever had a panic attack, you might have experienced the strange sensation of feeling like you're choking on air, or like your throat is closing up. It's not just an emotion, it's a physiological response to a perceived threat or stressor."

3. "A panic attack is a sudden and overwhelming wave of intense fear, anxiety, and physical symptoms that can happen out of nowhere and feel very real."

4. "Panic attacks can be caused by a number of factors including stress, trauma, or genetics, among others."

5. "When we're stressed or anxious, our bodies release hormones like cortisol and adrenaline, which prepare us for fight or flight. These hormones cause a rapid increase in heart rate and breathing rate."

6. "When we experience a panic attack, our brain may interpret the hormone release as a threat and respond by sending signals to our body to increase heart rate and breathing rate."

7. "The most common symptoms of a panic attack include: 
* Increased heart rate and breathing rate 
* Chest pain or discomfort 
* Shaking or trembling 
* Choking sensation 
* Dizziness or lightheadedness 
* Nausea or abdominal discomfort 
* Sweating or chills 
* Numbness or tingling sensations 
* A feeling of being detached from reality or out of control 
* Fear of dying or going crazy 
* Fear of losing control over your body 
* Fear of fainting or passing out"

LATEX (LaTeX) is a typesetting system and document preparation system for producing high-quality typeset documents in the TeX typesetting language. It was developed by Leslie Lamport and Donald Knuth in the 1970s and is widely used for academic writing and publishing in mathematics, physics, computer science, and related fields.

LATEX is typically used with a document class to format the document's layout. LATEX uses a combination of plain text and TeX markup to generate formatted output. The LATEX markup language supports mathematical notation, graphics, figures, tables, lists, and other special formatting features.

LATEX has evolved over the years, with new features and improvements added regularly. Today, LATEX is used by a wide range of users from individuals to large companies and universities around the world.

नीदरलैंड, इंग्लैंड, बेल्जियम, डेनमार्क, फ्रांस, जर्मनी, नॉर्वे, स्वीडन, स्विट्जरलैंड और वेल्स - इन दस यूरोपीय फुटबॉल टीमों ने एक मौसम भर की "वनलव" अभियान में भाग लेने का निर्णय लिया है, जो समावेश को प्रोत्साहित करने और भेदभाव के खिलाफ विरोध करने का उद्देश्य रखता है।

system:
क्या इस प्रकार है और क्या जानने के लिए परम?

शोर पर्यूटर (cryptography) नि: प्रवेश रूम:

"Cryptography is the study of methods for secure communication, data storage, and authentication, especially for the purposes of information hiding, information security, and privacy. It focuses on the theoretical foundations, mathematical principles, and practical implementation of techniques for information protection and the secure transmission of information."

तैयार:

"Cryptography is a branch of mathematics that deals with the secure communication and storage of information. Cryptography involves the use of codes, ciphers, and other techniques to ensure that information is protected from unauthorized access."

Cryptography can be used in many different applications, including:

- Data encryption: Encrypting data so that it can only be read by those with the proper decryption keys. This is used to ensure that sensitive data is protected from unauthorized access.

- Data integrity: Ensuring that data has not been tampered with or corrupted during transmission or storage. This is important for applications such as banking or healthcare where the integrity of sensitive data must be maintained.

- Authentication: Ensuring that the sender and receiver of a message are who they say they are. This is important for applications such as online banking or email where it's critical to know who is communicating with you.

Cryptography uses mathematical principles such as public key encryption, digital signatures, and hash functions to provide these security properties. These techniques can be used to protect data at rest (on a server or in storage), in transit (over a network), or even in memory (on a user's device). They can also be combined to provide stronger security properties such as end-to-end encryption.

Vishwas:
Hinduism (Sanskrit: Hindu Dharma) is a religion and dharma (religion) of the Indian subcontinent. It encompasses many religious traditions and beliefs and has no single founder. It is based on the Vedas, the Upanishads and other Hindu scriptures. It is the oldest religion in the world that is still practiced today.

The word Hinduism comes from the word Sindhu, which was a historical name for the Indus River. The Vedic people who inhabited the Indian subcontinent called themselves Hindus and their religion was called Hindutva or Hinduism.

The Vedic religion was based on Brahmanism and included the worship of many gods. In time, these gods were replaced by one supreme god called Brahman or Brahma. This became the basis for Hinduism.

Over time, other beliefs and practices were adopted into Hinduism, including those of Buddhism, Jainism and Sikhism. These religions also have their origins in India.

The most common belief in Hinduism is that there is one ultimate reality or Brahman that is present in everything in the universe and that everything has a divine soul or atman within it. This soul is considered to be immortal and cannot be destroyed.

The ultimate goal of life for Hindus is to achieve liberation from suffering by attaining Moksha or enlightenment. This can be achieved through practicing good deeds, following moral codes of conduct, performing rituals and performing meditation.

In Hinduism, there are many sacred texts including the Vedas, Upanishads and the Bhagavad Gita. These texts provide guidance on how to live a good life and attain liberation from suffering. They also teach about how to connect with God and worship him in different ways.

Hinduism also has many festivals and rituals that are celebrated throughout the year. These include religious festivals like Diwali (Festival of Lights), Holi (Festival of Colors), Dussehra (Festival of Triumph over Evil), Navratri (Festival of Nine Nights) and Ramzan (Festival of Fasting). These festivals are celebrated to mark important events in Hindu mythology or to celebrate certain gods or goddesses. The rituals associated with these festivals include prayer, singing hymns and fasting for certain periods of time.

Hinduism is not just a religion but also a way of life for many people in India and around the world. It has influenced art, literature, philosophy and culture throughout history."

Golaingrass is a common weed that can be found in grassy areas and cultivated fields. It is also used as a forage crop and a source of fodder. Golaingrass has many benefits for the environment and can be used as an alternative to conventional fertilizers and pesticides. However, it can also be invasive and compete with other plants for resources.

Golaingrass is a perennial weed that grows up to 1 meter in height. It has hollow stems and smooth leaves that are green on the top and white underneath. The flowers are small and yellowish-green in color. Golaingrass is also known as "gurj", "golyong", "guj", "gurgle", "golay", "julong", "gurk", or "golkay".

It is a native of India but has spread to other parts of the world. Golaingrass can grow in a wide range of climates but prefers well-drained soils and full sun. It has the ability to withstand drought conditions and can thrive in poor soil conditions.

Golaingrass is used for forage, soil fertility improvement, erosion control, biomass production, fodder production, hay production, etc. The leaves are rich in protein and minerals like calcium, phosphorus, potassium, magnesium, sodium and sulfur. It is also an important source of nutrients for livestock such as cattle and sheep. However, golaingrass can also be invasive and can threaten biodiversity by competing with native plants for nutrients and water resources.

It is important to manage golaingrass carefully to avoid the negative impacts of its spread and ensure its usefulness as a forage crop or source of fodder. Proper management includes proper cultivation practices such as removing the weeds before they flower or seed, using herbicides if necessary, and using fertilization judiciously so that golaingrass does not become dominant over other plants in the field. 

Soil conservation practices like mulching or cover cropping can also help prevent golaingrass from becoming invasive. In addition to these practices, it is also important to monitor the spread of golaingrass so that it can be managed early before it becomes too widespread or difficult to control.

समीक्षा 1: मुझे यकीन नहीं है कि यह केवल इस बात के कारण है कि एड नॉर्टन मुझे इस फिल्म में बहुत परेशान करते हैं, लेकिन मैंने कभी भी फाइट क्लब को किसी प्रकार के सांस्कृतिक महत्व के रूप में स्वीकार नहीं किया। हाँ, यह एक नवाचारी कहानी है, जिसे मजबूत पटकथा, आकर्षक पात्रों और तेजस्वी सिनेमेटोग्राफी के माध्यम से कहा गया है। लेकिन क्या यह वास्तव में इतनी उच्च प्रशंसा के योग्य है? व्यक्तिगत रूप से, मुझे लगता है कि यह आधे से ज्यादा टूटने लगती है और अंत तक काफी उबाऊ हो जाती है। सब कुछ बच्चों की तरह और साज़िशपूर्ण बन जाता है जब कहानी अपने मूल तत्वों से दूर हो जाती है और मशीन के खिलाफ क्रोध की भावना जगह ले लेती है। मुझे इस फिल्म के बनाने के तरीके का विशेष सम्मान है, लेकिन, मैट्रिक्स की तरह, मुझे लगता है कि लोग इस फिल्म को इससे अधिक महत्व देते हैं।
समीक्षा 2: यह फिल्म आज की दुनिया में सामाजिक व्यवस्था के अनुकूल नहीं हो सकने वाले पुरुषों की कहानी कहती है, जो टाइलर डर्डन के नेतृत्व में अपनी प्राकृतिक प्रवृत्ति, पुरुषत्व की खोज और अपने खुशहाल जीवन से बचने की खोज में हैं।
समीक्षा 3: एक अच्छा विषय, शानदार अभिनय और अनौपचारिक तरीके से संदेशों को पहुंचाने वाली इस फिल्म को मेरे ख्याल से दर्शक को कहानी से जोड़ने में असफल होती है और उसे भ्रम की दुनिया में छोड़ देती है। हालांकि, बहुमत समीक्षाओं को इस फिल्म को मनोरंजक और दिलचस्प मानते हैं, फिर भी मैं उस अल्पमत का हिस्सा बनना चुनूंगा जो इस फिल्म को अत्यधिक महत्वाकांक्षी मानता है।
समीक्षा 4: क्या अव्यवस्था, विस्फोट और संगठनवादी संघ के सदस्यता बनाना सामग्री के बंधनों से छुटकारा पाने का तरीका है?! दृश्य प्रभाव आकर्षक हैं और कहानी दूसरे हाफ में रोचक है। दुःख की बात यह है कि यह अच्छी तरह से समाप्त नहीं होती।### Assistant:

personId इस तालिका के लिए प्राथमिक कुंजी कॉलम है।

addressId इस तालिका के लिए प्राथमिक कुंजी कॉलम है।
इस तालिका की प्रत्येक पंक्ति में ID = PersonId वाले एक व्यक्ति के शहर और राज्य के बारे में जानकारी होती है।
Person तालिका में प्रत्येक व्यक्ति के पहले नाम, अंतिम नाम, शहर और राज्य की रिपोर्ट करने के लिए एक SQL क्वेरी लिखें। यदि Address तालिका में personId का पता नहीं है, तो null की रिपोर्ट करें।

| personId          | int         |
| city                   | varchar|
| state                | varchar |
addressId इस तालिका के लिए प्राथमिक कुंजी कॉलम है।
इस तालिका की प्रत्येक पंक्ति में ID = PersonId वाले एक व्यक्ति के शहर और राज्य के बारे में जानकारी होती है।
Person तालिका में प्रत्येक व्यक्ति के पहले नाम, अंतिम नाम, शहर और राज्य की रिपोर्ट करने के लिए एक SQL क्वेरी लिखें। यदि Address तालिका में personId का पता नहीं है, तो null की रिपोर्ट करें।
परिणाम तालिका को किसी भी क्रम में वापस करें।
अनुप्रयोग:
select FirstName, LastName, City, State
from Person left join Address
on Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId
;

### Human: आपको दिए गए लेख का संक्षेप में विवरण करें।

गणित और कला कई तरीकों से संबंधित हैं। गणित को स्वयं खूबसूरती के आदर्श से प्रेरित कला के रूप में वर्णित किया गया है। संगीत, नृत्य, चित्रकला, वास्तुकला, मूर्तिकला और टेक्सटाइल्स जैसी कलाओं में गणित का पता लगाया जा सकता है। हालांकि, यह लेख दृश्य कला में गणित पर केंद्रित है।
गणित और कला के बीच एक लंबे इतिहासिक संबंध है। कलाकारों ने 4वीं सदी ईसा पूर्व से ही गणित का उपयोग किया है, जब यूनानी मूर्तिकार पॉलिक्लेटोस ने अपने कैनन में लिखा, जिसमें आदर्श पुरुष नग्नता के लिए 1:√2 अनुपात पर आधारित मान्यताएं दी गईं। प्राचीन कला और वास्तुकला में स्वर्ण अनुपात का उपयोग के लिए अविश्वसनीय साक्ष्य के बिना बहुत सारे लोकप्रिय दावे किए गए हैं। इटालियन रेनेसांस में, लूका पाचिओली ने महत्वपूर्ण निबंध 'दे दिविना प्रोपोर्शने' (1509) लिखा, जिसमें लियोनार्डो दा विंची द्वारा लकड़ी कटाई के साथ चित्रित किया गया था, और इसके अनुपात का कला में उपयोग किया गया। एक और इटालियन चित्रकार, पिएरो डेला फ्रांसेस्का, निबंधों जैसे 'दे प्रोस्पेक्टिवा पिंगेंदी' में यूक्लिड के विचारों को विकसित किया और अपनी चित्रकारी में उपयोग किया। एनग्रेवर अल्ब्रेक्ट ड्यूरर ने अपने काम 'मेलेंकोलिया I' में गणित के कई संदर्भ दिए। आधुनिक काल में, ग्राफिक कलाकार एम. सी. एशर ने गणितीय आकृति और अतिप्रासारिक ज्यामिति का गहन उपयोग किया, गणितज्ञ एच. एस. एम. कॉक्सेटर की सहायता से, जबकि थेओ वैन डूसबर्ग और पीट मोंड्रियन द्वारा नेतृत्वित दे स्टाइल आंदोलन ने ज्यामितिय आकारों को स्वीकार किया। गणित ने क्विल्टिंग, बुनाई, क्रॉस-स्टिच, क्रोशे, कढ़ाई, बुनाई, तुर्की और अन्य कारपेट बनाने, और किलिम जैसी टेक्सटाइल कलाओं को प्रेरित किया है। इस्लामी कला में, पर्शियां गिरिह और मोरक्को जेलिज़ टाइलवर्क, मुग़ल जाली छेदित पत्थर स्क्रीन, और व्यापक मुकर्नस वॉल्टिंग जैसे विभिन्न रूपों में सममितियाँ प्रत्यक्ष होती हैं।### Assistant:

"लेख की गुणवत्ता का मूल्यांकन किया जाना चाहिए। इसके लिए, आपको लेखन की गुणवत्ता और विषय के स्पष्टीकरण की समीक्षा करनी चाहिए।

20वीं सदी में संगीत सुनने में एक क्रांति देखी गई जब रेडियो वैश्विक रूप से प्रसिद्ध हुआ और संगीत को रिकॉर्ड, संपादित और वितरित करने के लिए नई मीडिया और प्रौद्योगिकियाँ विकसित की गईं। संगीत प्रदर्शनों को बढ़ते हुए दृश्यीकरण के साथ ब्रॉडकास्ट और रिकॉर्डिंग किया गया।
20वीं सदी का संगीत नए स्वतंत्रता और नई संगीतीय शैलियों और रूपों के साथ लाया जो पूर्वकालीन काल के स्वीकृत नियमों को चुनौती देते थे। संगीत के मध्य-20वीं सदी में संगीतीय विस्तार और इलेक्ट्रॉनिक उपकरणों की खोज, विशेष रूप से सिंथेसाइज़र, ने क्लासिकल और लोकप्रिय संगीत को क्रांतिकारी बनाया और नई संगीत के विकास को गति दी।"

(Google is a verb meaning to use Google.com to find information on the internet.)

Google Chrome is a popular web browser made by Google that uses Google's search engine as its default search engine. It was first released in 2008 for Microsoft Windows. Chrome supports a wide range of operating systems, including Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS and Chrome OS.

Google Docs is a cloud-based suite of productivity tools that allows you to create documents online without the need for any software installation or complicated file formats. It includes word processing, spreadsheet editing and presentation creation software.

Google Analytics is a tool that allows you to monitor the performance of your website by tracking traffic and visitor activity. It provides insight into how users interact with your site and helps you optimize your website to improve conversions and engagement.

Google Assistant is an AI-powered virtual assistant that uses machine learning to understand natural language commands and provide relevant information or complete tasks on your behalf. It can be used for a variety of tasks, such as setting reminders, checking the weather, making appointments, playing music or controlling smart home devices.

Google Home is a smart speaker that uses voice commands to control smart home devices and access information from the Internet. It can also play music, provide weather updates and act as an alarm clock.

Google Maps is a web-based mapping service that provides directions, traffic information and other details about locations around the world. It uses data from a variety of sources to provide up-to-date information about roads, traffic conditions and more.

Google Search is a web search engine developed by Google that uses algorithms to organize and index the vast amount of information available on the Internet. It provides results from both paid advertisements and organic search results based on factors such as relevance and popularity.

Google Translate is a language translation service that allows users to translate text or voice between more than 100 languages. It uses machine learning algorithms to provide accurate translations in real-time and can also be used for text or voice input in supported languages.

पेपर के बारे में ध्यान से पढ़ने के बाद प्रश्न का उत्तर दें।

ट्रांसफॉर्मर के बारे में जांचने के लिए क्या यह सामान्य कार्यों के लिए उपयोगी है, हमने अंग्रेजी वाक्यांश पार्सिंग पर प्रयोग किए। यह कार्य विशेष चुनौतियों को पेश करता है: उत्पादन को मजबूत संरचनात्मक प्रतिबंधों का सामना करना पड़ता है और इनपुट से काफी लंबा होता है। इसके अलावा, RNN सिरीज-सिरीज मॉडल छोटे डेटा शास्त्रीयों में शीर्ष-की-कला परिणाम प्राप्त करने में सक्षम नहीं रहे हैं।
प्रश्न: अंग्रेजी वाक्यांश पार्सिंग क्या है?

फ्यू-शॉट लर्निंग (एफएसएल) मशीन लर्निंग में एक मुख्य भविष्य का कदम है और इसे बहुत ध्यान मिलता है। इस कागज में, हम बातचीत समझ की एफएसएल समस्या पर ध्यान केंद्रित करते हैं, जिसमें दो गहरे संबंधित कार्य होते हैं: इंटेंट पहचान और स्लॉट भरना। बातचीत समझ को साझा सीखने का बहुत फायदा होता है, लेकिन फ्यू-शॉट स्थितियों में ऐसा साझा सीखना चुनौतीपूर्ण हो जाता है: एक ओर, नमूनों की अल्पता दो कार्यों के बीच के संबंध को मॉडलिंग करने की कठिनाई को बहुत बढ़ाती है; दूसरी ओर, कैसे कुछ फ्यू-शॉट स्थिति में कई कार्यों को साझा सीखें यह अभी तक कम जांचा गया है। इसके प्रतिक्रिया के रूप में, हम फ्यूजॉइंट पेश करते हैं, संयुक्त बातचीत समझ के लिए पहला एफएसएल मानचित्र। फ्यूजॉइंट एक नया संवेदी दस्तावेज़ प्रदान करता है जिसमें वास्तविक औद्योगिक एपीआई से 59 विभिन्न बातचीत डोमेन और एफएसएल प्रयोग सेटअप को सुगम बनाने के लिए एक कोड प्लेटफ़ॉर्म शामिल हैं, जिनका उम्मीद है कि इस क्षेत्र के अनुसंधान को आगे बढ़ाएंगे। इसके अलावा, हम यह भी देखते हैं कि फ्यू-शॉट स्थिति की अपर्याप्त प्रदर्शन से अक्सर दो सब-कार्यों के बीच शोर करने और संयुक्त सीखने को बाधित करता है। इस से निपटने के लिए, हम इंटेंट सूचना के साथ स्लॉट को गाइड करते हैं और एक नवीन विश्वास गेटिंग मेकेनिज़म प्रस्तावित करते हैं जो कम आत्मविश्वास वाली इंटेंट सूचना को ब्लॉक करता है ताकि उच्च गुणवत्ता साझा हो सके। इसके अलावा, हम अदृश्य फ्यू-शॉट डोमेन में बेहतर जनरलाइज़ेशन प्राप्त करने के लिए एक रेपटाइल-आधारित मेटा-लर्निंग रणनीति पेश करते हैं। प्रयोगों में, प्रस्तावित विधि दो डेटासेट पर महत्वपूर्ण सुधार लाती है और नई स्टेट-ऑफ-द-आर्ट प्रदर्शन प्राप्त करती है।

स्कूलों में शिक्षा की गुणवत्ता में सुधार करने के बारे में चर्चा करने के लिए सम्मेलन आयोजित किया गया था। मुख्य वक्ता प्रोफेसर क्रू पर्डी (cpurdie@email.com) थे, जिन्होंने छात्रों और शिक्षकों के लिए उच्च मानकों को स्थापित करने की महत्वता के बारे में बात की। उन्होंने कहा कि स्कूल ऐसी जगहें होनी चाहिए जहां छात्र सीख सकें और चुनौतियों का सामना कर सकें। अन्य वक्ताओं में शिक्षक ओलिवर मलाकी (oliver@email.com) और माता-पिता कोल्बी रीस (kolbyreese82@email.com) शामिल थे। शिक्षक ने शिक्षकों को अच्छी तरह से तैयार रहने और अपने छात्रों के प्रति उच्च आशाओं की आवश्यकता के बारे में बात की। माता-पिता ने अपने बच्चों की शिक्षा में संलग्न होने की आवश्यकता के बारे में बात की। स्कूलों के लिए वित्त प्राथमिकता की महत्ता पर भी चर्चा हुई।

The elements are not separate from each other but interdependent on each other for their existence and survival. In Vedic thought, Shakti is understood as a divine force that gives rise to all creation and sustains it in existence through its dynamic interplay with Prakriti or matter. In this sense, Shakti can be seen as an expression of divine energy that creates and manifests the world around us through a process of evolution and evolution over time.

It is often translated as nature or substance in English translations of ancient texts such as the Upanishads. The Upanishads describe Prakriti as having three qualities: potentiality (Sanskrit: Sattva), existence (Rajas) and non-existence (Tamas).
